messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Foster kids
messages.msgSnippet: Trisha, I know someone in my homeschool support group who adopted the foster children she took in and is now h s ing them. I can ask her for you, but I don t
messages.messageBody:
Trisha,
I know someone in my homeschool support group who adopted the foster children
she took in and is now h's'ing them. I can ask her for you, but I don't know
if they were already adopted by the time they were school age. My dh and I
would like to take in foster children too so please e-mail me privately or
regularly to let me know how the process is for you. Thanks!
Bridget
H"schooling the motley crew on Long Island!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Foster kids
messages.msgSnippet: Trisha- A good friend of mine homeschools and fosters. BUT here in Michigan, she cannot homeschool foster children. Her dd is in 8th grade now... Ron and
messages.messageBody:
Trisha-
A good friend of mine homeschools and fosters. BUT here in Michigan, she
cannot homeschool foster children. Her dd is in 8th grade now...
Ron and Stephanie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Foster kids
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Trisha, A friend and neighbor of mine has two foster children. We re in NJ and the boys are from NY. My friend was told she could NOT hs the boys. It may be
messages.messageBody:
Hi Trisha, A friend and neighbor of mine has two
foster children. We're in NJ and the boys are from NY.
My friend was told she could NOT hs the boys. It may
be different in each state I am not sure. Good luck in
your path!
Jill

--- Trisha Sides <yschild@...> wrote:
> Hello all,
> Does anyone out there homeschool foster
> children? I am very open to
> being a foster parent, but don't know how I would
> handle schooling. I
> wouldn't want to send some to school and keep others
> at home, but I don't
> know if I'd be allowed to hs foster kids. I won't
> send my son to school and
> I'm afraid it would cause conflicts if we had other
> children who had to go.
> The foster children might resent my son for not
> having to go, and even my
> son might think he was missing something. Has anyone
> had any experience with
> this? Any ideas?
>
> Trisha
>
